name: Scrambled Eggs with Salmon and Pesto
author: birgit
summary: I invented this recipe when we had sleepover guests and a lot of leftover salmon from dinner. A wonderful Sunday breakfast for a crowd! I've subsequently also made it with smoked salmon.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon butter, or more as needed
1 tablespoon rice vinegar, or more to taste
1 pinch salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1 ½ cups freshly grated Parmesan cheese, or to taste
directions: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-low heat and cook onion until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes
Beat eggs in a large bowl and mix in milk and pesto
Pour into skillet; cook and stir for 3 to 5 minutes
Add salmon and keep stirring until eggs start to set on the edges of the skillet, 5 to 8 minutes
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese; cook and stir until eggs are scrambled to your desired consistency
